Job Opportunities with the Principles for Responsible Investment

The UN-backed Principles for Responsible Investment (PRI) initiative is a partnership between UNEP Finance Initiative, the UN Global Compact and institutional investors. The PRI Secretariat’s role is to promote adoption and implementation of the Principles globally. The PRI now has over 640 signatories, representing over US$20 trillion in assets. See further details at: www.unpri.org

Assistant to the Executive Director

Location: London
Duration: 18 month contract, with yearly extensions after that
Start date: ASAP
Remuneration: £26,000 p.a. (fixed contract inclusive rate: no additional pension or health benefits)

Summary
This role involves providing administrative, organisational and professional support to the Executive Director. It is primarily an administrative support role but will also involve preparing briefings and research for meetings, a task that will require knowledge of responsible investment and our signatories. This person will also serve as the Secretary to the Board, and will be responsible for managing Board documentation and minutes. We are looking for someone who can demonstrate attention to detail, strong organisational skills and research capacity. The candidate must be very comfortable with technology, web research and online applications.

Description
  • Providing general administrative support to the Executive Director
  • Organising meetings and appointments, including agendas, logistics and minutes
  • Arranging travel, accommodation and visas and preparing itineraries
  • Serving as the Board secretary: scheduling meetings, managing agendas and minutes and tracking Board decisions and documentation.
  • Attending meetings with the Executive Director as appropriate
  • Assisting in managing the London office
  • Preparing briefings on meetings and conferences
  • Coordinating PRI speakers at various events and conferences
  • Assisting with other PRI work streams where required
Requirements
  • Extremely well organised and efficient
  • Ability to work effectively without direct supervision, self-starter
  • Ability to relate to and engage with a wide range of investment professionals from different regions
  • Passionate about the goals of the PRI, and some knowledge and understanding of responsible investment issues (previous experience in responsible investment not required)
  • High-level writing and proofreading skills
  • Excellent people skills, tact and diplomacy
  • Familiarity with the use of online applications (we use Google Apps, Skype, Salesforce, etc.)
  • High-level web research ability
  • One other language relevant to financial markets would be helpful
  • Degree in a relevant field
  • Relevant work experience
  • Home broadband and PC with Skype
  • Willing to attend conference calls over multiple time zones from time-to-time (this is not a typical 9-5 job)
  • Ability to travel internationally when required
The successful candidate will work at the heart of responsible investment globally and will learn a great deal about the field and the organisations involved. There will be a lot of contact with PRI signatories and the capacity to build a strong personal network. While predominantly an Executive Assistant role, it will provide considerable scope for professional growth and is ideal for an early career professional wishing to get a foot in the door, or a person seeking to move into responsible investment from another industry.

Please send your CV and covering letter explaining why you are suited to this job to info@unpri.org by Wednesday 23 December 2009. Please attach your covering letter as a separate document, rather than in the email text. Interviews will be in London on the week of 11 January 2010. For more information, please contact info@unpri.org.

Administration Fellow

Location: London
Duration: 6 months initially, subject to extension after performance review.
Start date: ASAP
Remuneration: £1,200/month (for 5 days per week). This is a fixed contract inclusive rate: no additional pension or health benefits.

Summary
This role involves providing administrative support to the London office and the PRI Business Manager, and processing new signatories to the PRI. The successful candidate will work at the heart of responsible investment globally and will learn a great deal about the field and the organisations involved. This role will provide considerable scope for professional growth and is ideal for an early career professional wishing to get a foot in the door, or a person seeking to move into responsible investment from another industry.

Description
  • Processing signatory sign-ups to the PRI and responding to enquiries regarding signing up
  • Assisting the PRI Business Manager
  • Providing general administrative support to the London office: scheduling meetings and calls and organising travel reservations and visas
  • Creating agendas and taking notes for meetings and conference calls
  • Assisting with other PRI work streams where required
  • Maintaining and developing the PRI signatory database
Requirements
  • Extremely well organised and efficient
  • Ability to work effectively without direct supervision, self-starter
  • High-level writing and proofreading skills
  • Excellent people skills, tact and diplomacy
  • Familiarity with the use of online applications (we use Google apps, Skype, Salesforce, etc.)
  • High-level web research ability
  • One other language relevant to financial markets would be useful
  • Home broadband and PC with Skype
  • Willing to attend conference calls over multiple time zones from time-to-time (this is not a typical 9-5 job)
Please send your CV and covering letter explaining why you are suited to this job to info@unpri.org by Wednesday 23 December 2009. Please attach your covering letter as a separate document, rather than in the email text. Interviews will be in London on the week of 11 January 2010. For more information, please contact info@unpri.org.
